nodeDataArray.belief: An eye for an eye is a fair exchange.
The continuation of this expedition serves my personal desire for survival.
The suffering of others is acceptable if it means that I survive.
Real strength lies in precision.
Freedom is earned by discipline and bravery.
If I do good work others will be proud of me!
I will raise ranks quickly if I expose all my superiors weaknesses
There’s few things a good punch can’t solve
My lucky coin and strong belief in King and Country will let me return home rich
If we let down family, crew or crown, we are doomed.
The smart one always wins
The upper class needs to pay for letting us work to death.
The world is full of wonders that I can’t wait to see!
I will endure this expedition because I have to.
Undying loyalty to our leaders is the strongest motivating force and will ensure our success.
By doing my duty as a Royal Marine, I will do right by my men.
Trying to please others is futile and will not lead to progress.
Men are replaceable, my discoveries are not. (And neither am I.)
I have an inherent ability to be always right
If I don't do dangerous discoveries, I'll be stifled by my heritage
My perfectionism keeps everyone safe
To regain my hard earned privilege, I have to become a national idol.
Truth should never stand in the way of a good story
I will make sure that I get credit for my ideas
Everyone will do as I say, for the Lord speaks through me
Every hard working English male should be treated equally, no matter their rank.
My faith justifies my actions
Completing this expedition will prove my sanity
Not taking risks will get you stuck in place.
Discipline and order make us better than the others.
I have to pass God’s test.
My disciplined perfectionism will show that I am the better gentleman.
I have to make the best of each day as it comes.
If I only search long enough, I surely will belong somewhere
I’ll only survive by being the criminal the society wants me to be
Loyality brings me hope and without hope we’re lost.
Societal adherence is not defeat.
My hard work will make up for the selfishness and incompetence of others.
To ensure the success of this expedition, we cannot repeat the mistakes of the past.
I will make my father proud.
I need to make my mark on the world.

linkDataArray.text: You never understood why out of all of your subordinates, Keenan never seems to understand what discipline is. You plan to enact some punishment towards him the next time he steps out of line to make sure everyone understands that you value discipline and show Fisher that you have the situation under control.

The Mate is your free out-of-jail card. You know he is a drunk and that he wants to fuck the Navigators wife, Tamsen Donner. When you caught him drunken on watch, he shared his whiskey with you and told you all those stories. He also told you that he is a follower of the Quaker beliefs, which definitely would not amuse the captain. You promised to keep everything a secret, if he helps you out, should the situation arise. Since then you occasionally meet to share a sip of whiskey or two.

The Irish marine is somewhat of a friend. He caught you quite drunk on watch once. You shared a lot of your good whiskey with him that night. This alone would deserve punishment, but you also mentioned that you like Tamsen Donner and some of your religious believes, which definitely would not get your captains blessing. Keenan promised to keep this night a secret. In turn you promised to protect him from your captains punishments, should the situation arise. Since then you occasionally meet to share a drink. You are responsible to keep the peace after all.
The private seems like a man who will use his fists to solve any problem. Charming him seems a good way to make him loyal to you.

He needs to learn some discipline. Some men are only out there for themselves. and Keenan definitely gives a shit about discipline. After you saved his life, he thinks you are on his side. You aim to use that to learn about his schemes and make sure he will be punished for them eventually.

You owe him big. He saved your life, getting injured himself. You are impressed how he managed to operate on himself afterwards. This man is brave. You swore to protect him. Trust doesn’t come easy to you, but he definitely proofed to be on your side and you learned to like the man.
The young sailor can still be shaped. You gave him your rum ration. He will be useful to have some contacts to the sailors.
David young will be a great cartographer one day. You want to pass on your knowledge to him.
Father figure

Patrick is the other cabin boy. He is four months your younger and you know that you’re the more experienced one. He’s the only one on the expedition ranking as low as you and he’s an easy one to talk into all sorts of things.
protect John, even though he’s older, but his health causes him problems.
Your brother. You want to make the world better for him.
either hates her or loves her? Could see her as the only worthy female member of the expedition? Could see her as a threat to his relationship with Benjamin Briggs?
Your former husband
Wants to impress him

you were captivated by the strong-willed Anne Lister from the first moment you met. This is the kind of woman you want to be! (Although you’ll never be as wealthy or as elegant or as well-bred as her.) She also kissed you at some point. (Maybe) You need to figure out what that means… (Cue bi panic…) (Maybe also religious panic?)
Rivalry between the two stewards
The mate is a drunk, this can be used. Wants his job maybe?

A good friend of you and your husband. You taught him about poetry, he taught you how to shoot a pistol. You like his way of taking every day as it comes. It is a good change to your husbands reckless way of doing things, that you may like a bit too much. Anyways, you want to get to know him closer.
for both of you this is not the first marriage and you know how quickly things can go sour. So you do your best to take care of him.
Misses being a physician, maybe seeks a chance to help out as well
IDEAS fellow male scientist. Can bond over cool discoveries. Shared experience in exploring Australia. Can be casually sexist together I guess???

your fellow medical professional. The fellow definitely seems to know his business, but is often preoccupied with other duties on the ship. You don’t mind though, as this gives you more opportunities to research and treat the various medical issues that are common on long sea voyages.

The young marine came to you early on in this voyage for some minor medical attention. You’ve never met someone before who you loathed on sight, but something about the Private made your skin crawl. You hid it behind a mask of medical professionalism, prescribed him a dose of black draught and sent him on his way. You’ve kept a quiet eye on him in case he does something suspicious and the you will report it to the expedition leaders.
Misses being a physician, maybe seeks a chance to help out as well

Even though he dismisses her work, or publishes under his own, he trusts her. Would allow her to manipulate him in some way. We need to think about how “publishing” works though. Maybe just reporting to the superiors.

You like how passionate the young woman is about her beliefs. In this short time you have somewhat become friends, although she is rather below your status. Although she’s a good kisser, she’s still a girl and nothing more than a cute pastime.
Two eccentric German besties. Support system for unlikable characters.
Wrote a story that features some other members of the expedition without realising that they are also here.

Only allows her to add petty details to the map and will not allow her to be part of the mapping process. Does not think women have the ability to accurately cart the land and is afraid if he did allow her to map anything, lives would be lost due to her incompetency. Constantly dismisses her input and observations.
This man just has no discipline and is way too close to the crew. You will take any chance to have him replaced by someone more capable.
Curtis is your wife Hannah Fisher in disguise. You realize, that you still love her, but seeing her as a male just disgusts you to your core.
Your assistant. As his superior you can just put everything onto him, that does not interesst you. This suits you just fine as long as you get credit for his good work.

You don’t like the American. You want to shut him from access to the spirits storage. He entitles himself too much and clearly has a drinking problem. As a mate, he is above you in the hierarchy though so it might not be easy.

Your wife and your future. In the end you do the things you do, for your family. You cannot wait until everyone is safe and you found your place to settle. You need your wife to help to get the other settlers and women in line.
Fellow American and a friend. Can bond over English stuck-up-ness. You need him to get the ear of the other officers.
A good friend. You like her. Maybe even a bit too much?
Fellow American. Good friend. Can chill and get lose of the English stuck-up-ness together with his family and other settlers.

Since you first took to the sea you have followed your beloved Captain from ship to ship. You seek his approval always. You protect him from threats. You are devoted to him come what may. And you believe he is equally devoted to you.
Your captain treats you well. You don’t envy his difficult position and want to support him, as long as he doesn’t bother you with his blind love for God.

He seems like a god fearing fella but also weak and under the influence of his wife. You want to break his bond to his wife and send him to the real dangers, so god can test him. Maybe you can lead him to the light.
You totally admire the chaplain. Your goal is to impress him and show him that you are willing to do everything it takes to serve the almighty.

You were serving madeira wine to the Expedition Leader when you slipped and spilled it all over him. Now you’re certain that he’s keeping an extra-close eye on you. You can’t risk losing the pay that this job gets you so you’re being careful about your work standards and hiding your true beliefs around him.
The love of your life. You will make sure, that she’ll get everything she wants on this journey.

You want to push him to be more ambitious. He needs to get more than what he does by his current contract. He should raise in rank. Or make sure he at least gets to keep some of the found treasure for himself.
